  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable, java.io.Serializable

    public class ObjectRecognitionFitnessFunction2
extends HyperNEATFitnessFunction
    Determines fitness based on how close Activator output is to a target.

      • initialiseEvaluation

        public void initialiseEvaluation()
        Iterates through chromosomes. For each, transcribe it to an Activator and present the stimuli to the activator. The stimuli are presented in random order to ensure the underlying network is not memorizing the sequence of inputs. Calculation of the fitness based on error is delegated to the subclass. This method adjusts fitness for network size, based on configuration.
        Overrides:
        initialiseEvaluation in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT

      • evaluate

        protected double evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
              Activator activator,
              int threadIndex)
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        Evaluate an individual genotype. This method is called from BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(List) and must be overridden in order to evaluate the genotypes. If the fitness function defines a performance value then this method should call Chromosome.setPerformanceValue(double). In a multi-objective set-up only the performance defined by the primary fitness function will be used. If a performance value isn't defined it will be set to the overall fitness value. This default implementation returns 0.
        Overrides:
        evaluate in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        Parameters:
        genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        activator - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
        threadIndex - The index of the evaluator thread. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        Returns:
        The fitness value, in the range [0, 1]. Note that if novelty is the only objective then the returned value is ignored.

      • scale

        protected void scale(int scaleCount,
         int scaleFactor,
         HyperNEATTranscriber transcriber)
        Description copied from class: HyperNEATFitnessFunction
        Allow a sub-class to make the necessary changes when a substrate scale occurs. If implemented, then at a minimum this method will usually need to set new values for the width and height of each layer of the substrate, and the connection range if applicable, via HyperNEATTranscriber.resize(int[], int[], int).
        Overrides:
        scale in class HyperNEATFitnessFunction
        Parameters:
        scaleCount - A count of how many times a scale has previously occurred. In the first call this has value 0.
        scaleFactor - The amount the substrate is being scaled by.
        transcriber - The transcriber that generates substrates (on which HyperNEATTranscriber.resize(int[], int[], int) may be called).
